alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 7:22AM EST until January 28 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Essex, Passaic, and Morris Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Passaic River At Pine Brook. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, street flooding begins in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM, the river level was 19.05 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river level in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 AM Saturday was 19.08 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall back below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 19.05 Sat 615 am 18.6 18.3 Crested &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening by 700 PM EST.
